positive.review: RubberBandGames can you please make it so that you can play with your freinds even if you are not on the same platform because i want to play with my freinds and they are all on diffrent platforms.
Idk what to say, but I had it since early access, and it was worth every penny.

Brilliant! i almost play it every day so far i have been playing this game for 152 hours i highly recomend it if you love causing chaos and love playing with your friends this is the game for you [Please note none of this is scripted]
It's a fun and relaxing game. However some game achievements are too time consuming and RNG-based (like museum artifacts and fishing).

a ridiculously cute and endearing game to play with your friends or solo. tons of fun mini games with wacky physics, a surprisingly detailed world to explore, and lots of customization for your little fellas. no real complaints! solid game 8/10
Honestly, Wobbly Life is just super fun and goofy. You run around, mess with physics, and do whatever ridiculous stuff you want. Not much else to say, just a good time!
adorable little game to play with a loved one, esp. if one or both of u are a lil devious

May not look like it for some at a first glance - but this here, without a shadow of a doubt, is literally one of THE best games ever made. There's so much fun content to explore here it's absolutely INSANE. Every single moment is filled with joy and adventure, every session feels new and exciting. For extra bliss, if you can, make sure to grab a friend or few, or a significant other to experience it all together with. Either way - if you're reading this, just get the game already - you won't regret it!~

Fantastic game all round, but even better for families. 4 player local split screen and a big open world is almost unheard of and they've nailed it.

While the grabbing controls can be frustrating at first you soon realise thats part of what makes this game special.

There is so much to do, collect, discover and customise you can drop hours without even realising.

This game is absolutely amazing in every aspect! This game has it all!! Plenty to do, funny moments, puzzles, lots of action, you can fly or ride on any vehicle, it contains plenty of secrets, and clearly has recieved a lot of love and attention from its developers, who are always working hard on this game!! 100% recommend <3
its a fun wobbly game with funny psyicsh just for a cool rp if you want
the game has so much to do yet you never get bored of it however it dose lag on some devices a perfect journey and i can see myself in 5 years still playing this banger
Fantastic and silly game that's always a good time. And of course even better if you bring friends along.

wow just wow, this game is so silly but there are so many things to do! the map(s) are covered in secerets and easter eggs, wobbly lifes update never fail to supprise me
a truely wobbly game
what to do with grandma...
its very good for a casual game or if its a casual game anyway its pretty fun and the graphics are pretty good. its a great game

I can prove I am bad at being on a moonhopper not just in real life!!

(The fails I make and shenanigans during playing this game all add to the fun.)

Also never knew I needed to answer the question of what sound a motorised couch would make. 
Unsure this can be unheard.

My kids love it! It has a very cute art style and there are hours of in game activities to keep your kids entertained. This is the type of title that shines when played with friends. I bought this 3 times so that all my kids can play together and combined they have about 500 hours in the game. The latest space update also added allot of new activities in a new setting, space.
This is a great game to play with friends, or by yourself, its cozy and has a lot to explore
Very fun and amusing with some friends. very chill and there is quite a lot to do.
Me and my young Son love playing this game together , it drives me insane but you just have to love its splendour. Not forgetting its wobbly madness . Great Adventure.
Great game, funny, and fun-ness.
its is very relaxing if you want to play with friends or have fun its is creative with its style of character and the funyy graphics and its unique style
really fun lots of challenges to explore massive map to play on
i just like this game its have the something that i a like it have an open world and its a creative game
not a lot to say, you mess around, i love messing around. this game was made for me
so fun i got a bad laptop and for an openworld game it runs fine
i love this game its great too play with friends and is relaxing
Fun unique style and gameplay. Fun wardrobe. Everything you buy feels like an award not the end of a grind.
A good game if you want something to just chill and play little minigames or have a sandbox to mess around in, not really much more to it than that.
Very fun game with the homies and a TON to discover and have a couple laughs over
Great game for all ages a lot to do lots of hidden secrets nice to just chill sometimes and love the multiplayer

Wobbly Life is that one game where you watched that one Youtuber play and you wanted to play it too. It's relaxing I'd say and you can do a lot of stuff like some other sandbox games I like (Amazing Frog?). You can change your avatar, have fun exploring in different vehicles, and most importantly..., It's CO-OP! Fun game if you wanna just relax from a long day with a snack to the side and watching a Youtube video as you do. Overall... Great game 10/10! Would Recommend!
this game is fantastic and great. very fun with friends
This game is the enbodyment of insane I love it.(sorry for my lack of spelling)
Its fun with friends and to play online but other than doing secret quests around the map its kinda boring.
Just sit back and relax its very fun with the vehicles!

It's a really enjoyable open-world sandbox game to play with family and friends.
My little sisters enjoyed this game greatly; they had loads of fun driving a tractor through the city.
I found it even more fun to steal said tractor and crash it into them. <3

[b][u]9 out of 10 tractors[/u].[/b]
It would be 10 out of 10, but their wobbly bodies exploded our tractor.
Spent most of the time dragging my friends around, and being dragged around by my friends. A+ game. No notes.

It combines all the things I love about the open world style for games, it has fun and interesting mechanics, adventure styled gasmeplay, long and exciting missions, and plenty of collectables and jobs to keep you interested and fulfilled.
Wobbly Life is the antidote to a busy day. It's smooth, it's relaxing, it lets your worries melt away. This game is your moment of zen.
very fun and whimsical game. great with friends
This is such a casual and fun game to play with friends!
One of the best life sim games i have ever played (out of 2). The large amount of jobs and stuff to do will keep you hooked and going to space was weird and amazing. :)

Amazing game peak, amazing game after a day of work this game is just chill back relax but if u want a challange this is also a the game as theres loads of tricky puzzles and diffrent type of puzzles that require you to use ur brain but you dont need to use ur brain much. Overall... AMAZING game very fun this game is like if gta 5 had a baby with family friendly
space update made this game 10X better! best game to relax

Wobbly Life a game About real life its a good game and i love everything and i love the graphics Also a New Banger came out and its called the space update the game is awesome a very fun game oh oh and also you can play this with friends also shout out to cae and superdojo9 they are really good wobbly life youtubers and a ton of fun in this world of wobbly life also warning there is a lot of parkour in space but its not really a parkour game soooo and you can try this out for yourself and yeah its for 949 bucks so see you.
Fun Game With Mysterys And Jobs, Fun With Multiplayer

This is a great place to hang out with your kids. There is a ton of places to go, jobs to do, and collectibles to find. The game is full of puzzles and easter eggs delivered with delightful humour. The movement is perfectly imperfect, and lives up to the name Wobbly Life. 

I have bought copies for each of my kids and spent 140 hours on Planet Wobb and out in Space with them. 

The space update for 1.0 added a ton of content that can become a grind, but also means there is a lot to do and see. There is always a project you can work on together.

This is clearly a project the Dev team is passionate about, and it shows.
I love playing this game with friends, there's so much wacky and wobbly things to do can't wait to see them add more~
I have been playing this and it's has been so addicting, there is so many things to do in this game and I love how open and lively it is. Recommend this game if you have a chance.

Very good game lots of content without even thinking about mods 
Crossplay would be nice
other than that a good game

Amazing game that combines the exploration of an open world with the physics that let you do whatever you want. Is best to play with friends but is still quite fun to do alone. Tons of content and definitely worth the price.
Excellent game! Lots of fun for all ages. It is clear that the developers work very hard to improve the game and to keep it updated.
A really fun and silly game to play with your friends. Also really fun on your own.
Great game to play with any age group in the family, keeps the kids and I busy for hours! The Space Update was Amazing! Free Content is always a plus!

Wonderful game with loads of content, in addition to the fun you can make for yourself. An absolute blast with friends that rarely fails to be relaxing. For the price? It's a steal. If you're on the fence, try it. What could go wrong?
nice game for chill and relax
Best game i have on steam and one of the best games ive ever played recommened lots of content

My friend across the world and I have played this game off an on since it was in its early days. Grabbing and dragging each other off docks, running into each other with cars, and doing all the jobs it has had to offer either well or as an absolute disaster. It is fun, cute, and worth every cent and moment of play.
Melhor jogo para jogar em splitscreen com crianças, e que ainda tem muitos desafios difíceis até para os adultos kkkk.
Brilliant, fun and cooperative... just give me the reward of steam awards

This is like GTA but Rated E for Everyone. This game is amazing, especially if you have young kids who want to game. There's no real objectives, just explore the vast world and discover things. There are PLENTY of things to do, even for older games.

Fun game but no real idea why you do anything? Played with some friends, we jumped in blinde because we enjoy all these wobbly games but we had no idea what we were doing or why we were doing it. I wish they explained some of thee things you can do.
Love this game. It is simple to play with alot of things to do. I like that it is Deck Ready and does not eat too much battery. Thanks for the space expansion. It doubles the fun in this game.
10/10 game, fun but painful at times, fun with friends

perfect game with the content to keep both Kids and Adults alike with its variety of activities, mini games, secrets and Many more things to see... You can know for sure that this game is something special.

My son (6 at the time) begged me for this game so we bought it under my wife's profile.  We watched and noticed that it was basically like a GTA for kids - flying controls were the standard you'd expect, driving, etc.  No real violence so that was a major plus.

Then he learned you could play with others so I bought it for myself so I could play with him.  At first it was a bit annoying and juvenile... but it grew on me.  Its actually pretty good writing and there's a lot to it.

Then the Space Update came out.  Its basically a second world to do all the crazy stuff you did before.  Its imaginiative, funny and tries to keep things fun and light.  If you've got  kid would might love this game, its worth two purchases to play with them.

A very fun and charming game. A decent sized open world with plenty of activities to do, goals to work toward, things to see and so on. The jobs and side quests are a blast, and cycling through them all with a friend is even better. Very silly and whimsical, and one of the most enjoyable and laid-back games I have played of its kind in a long time. Would recommend
It's a beautiful game: you get to go on adventures, it's great with family friends, and you can make your brother rage quit!
Funny and goofy game that is better with friends
Very fun and great with friends!! Highly recommend to people who are willing to have fun with friends OR solo.
Very fun, lots of content, great with friends
great game, but i hate how the ragdoll takes quite long.
This game is super fun. Never boring. Updates all the time. Just PERFECT.
Wobbly life is very interactive and fun there are lots of jobs in it and there are cars the game is overall very good and worth the money

Me like having job
Me like this game
Me like exploring the map
Me like having fun with my friends in this game
Me think it is a very very fun multiplayer game where you can do the cool quests or just do jobs with your friends

- Fun couch split-screen co-op game.
- Great controller support
- Fun missions
- Wobbly

Its pretty fun, goofy pretty good map and really fun to play with friends. Though i wish you could upgrade the graphics somehow its supposed to be goofy but i would likemore realistic graphics. Overall 7.8/10
Very Fun and Chill Game. The space update/release of the game changed everything and in my opinion made the game better. I recommend it

Well. What would I need to say to Wobbly life? It's a pretty good game, just for chilling and having fun. Playing with friends or alone or maybe also just to grind for the next mansion. 

It is nice for a older as well as younger audience and is just for everyone.
Can just recommend it.
A great game, hard and easy and simple every person should try Wobbly life.

It's fun and silly, always a ton of fun when I play it. The slight jank is part of the experience, and I just love the whimsical stuff that you can get up to in this game.

It rewards exploration with a lot of secrets and coins, the artstyle is easy on the eyes and the missions are a good mix of simple and challenging content.

I recommend it especially if you have a friend or partner willing to hop on.
this game is good if you js wanna play a chill game sometimes funny too and the new space update is good

This game is amazing. I loved playing it with my kids. There is enough challenge at times that it can be difficult even for an adult, but it's generally easy enough that young children can pick it up and play. All the different jobs and quests are also incredibly fun and well thought out considering the physics of the game. I wish this game was better known as it deserves some recognition for all the wonderful things it does.

So much to say about this game and it's all so good! The Devs have done an amazing job making this game and and keeping it up and exciting, definitely worth getting! Plus the stupid things you can do with friends is SO MUCH FUN!!!
My son says this game is fun.  The puzzles are challenging and fun.  It's a very good game! :)
I love this open world funny sandbox game, tons to do. I suggest having friends play too, it's amazing!
Great game for adults and their kids to play. Lots of adventure and collectibles.
Giant map to explore with tons of fun secrets and jobs, the world is very lively and a ton of fun to explore, as well as even more!

My seven-year-old absolutely loves Wobbly Life! It’s silly, creative, and packed with fun things to do. The open world lets kids explore, take on goofy jobs, and discover secrets at their own pace. The humor is perfect for young players, and watching them laugh while wobbling around is priceless. If you’re looking for a kid-friendly game full of imagination and fun, Wobbly Life is an easy recommendation!

I figured this game would be fun, but I had no idea just how fantastic and whimsical it would be, especially with friends. It really is a unique, magical experience that captures the joy of playing pretend and exploring as a child.
This game is fantastic. The developers put their heart and soul into this game, and it shows. cute silly game thats hours of fun for kids of all ages.
Chill game, it even has Splitscreen multiplayer which I love to see in more modern titles
very fun game especially if you're looking for something to play with your kids that doesnt make you wanna commit to the forever nap instead

It's an excellent chill multiplayer game that you can pick up with your friends.
Easy to pick up and play for both short and longer sessions, which is nice when you're a working adult.
1400 Hours played. Perfect game for kids to wobble around in a safe environment.
Very chill and laid back game good for keeping kids busy

Wow! What a fun and cool game. I want to start by saying how amazing it is to see how much has been added over time. The amount of new content, features, and activities is incredible, and it really shows how dedicated the developers are. Great job, Devs — you’ve done fantastic work!
I've been playing since it released, it's really cool seeing this game get new updates throughout the years :D
beatifull way of enjiy a funny and simple co-work with family and friends

negative.review: Tired playing in multiplayer and the controller delay made the game totally unplayable with multiplayer.

I cannot stand this game and my son demanded I buy it.
There is so much reading to do and you would think they might have made a voice instructions by now to save time.
There is stairs in many buildings, but the character cannot climb stairs. I mean honestly!!
The instructions are always vague, and we spend hours just trying to find something that is hidden or disappears the moment you drop it. honestly. My son is asking me to do everything because its making him upset all the time. I didnt buy the game for me, its terrible, but he keeps making me play.

Maybe I should have been able to tell, but this is a children's game and that wasn't obvious from the store page. It's not bad for what it is, but if you're not a young child this won't resonate with you, and you'll be out $25
u stink like a wobbly poo
Constant Crashes
ehhh

I'm a bit desperate to get the devs to see feedback about motion sickness; it seems to be a common complaint. 

I've been gaming my entire life, and I have Never experienced motion sickness from a game until Wobbly Life. I genuinely feel like I'm going to vomit. And that Sucks, because I really, really want to play this with my partner. We had a blast for about 15 minutes before it started to sink in, and it got worse and worse for me. This game seems like so much fun, with lots of things to do!! I want to experience them!!!

Lowering the sensitivity of the camera does not work. I understand that the character's physics need to be wobbly (the point of the game), but the camera is so jerky. It doesn't stop when I do, and it feels like the camera shakes every single second. I just can't take it. Please make this game more accessible. </3

I truly, genuinely want to be able to play this.

Overall, it was a really good game. It was a lot of fun to explore the world and there was a lot to do. But there is one problem with this game:

Since the archaeology update, the game has become quite grindy. Because you have to do a job that takes far too long and then only have a small chance of getting a rare artifact, it's simply not worth exploring this extremely large part of the game.

When fishing was introduced, it got even worse. Once again, there's a low probability of catching a specific fish. And you need so many of them that it's no fun to complete the book.

But with the new space update, they've taken it to the extreme. I mean, who comes up with the idea of introducing a completely new currency, expensive prices everywhere again, and then also introducing such inefficient jobs? It just makes the game far too repetitive and boring.


All in all, I feel like RubberBandGames has driven their game into the ground. After a while, it just becomes too monotonous and boring.

I like the idea of this game but the execution is kinda annoying, if you raise your arms the camera just zooms into your head and the sfx are grating if I could just turn off the bubbly talking noise then I could have probably played more but it irritates me to hear, also if you support controllers you should support all controllers not just Xbox format. I'll just stick to playing Human Fall Flat, better controls and at least they have the option for chat instead of being all Helen Lovejoy about it.

It's a collection of minigames and a fair sized open world but I'm just bored to tears while playing it. Maybe worth $5 or something, which I never like to say about a game because the devs evidently worked hard on it. But if I can only spend $30 every month or so on myself, then I'm not spending it on games that leave me this bored.

Basically, I had a skill issue liking this game. But I'm leaving this review as a warning to others like me who have a hard time giving themselves objectives.

I was SO excited to play this game! However, after about 5 minutes I found myself feeling extremely motion sick because of the wobbly camera movements. I know the game is called Wobbly Life, but I had hoped there would be an accessibility setting of kind to at least stabilise the camera. 
I would love to recommend this game, but I think it needs a bit more tinkering in the accessibility department.
Tired playing in multiplayer and the controller delay made the game totally unplayable with multiplayer.

Bought this and had to refund due to multiple controllers input being broken.
At least when on a steam deck dock with two controllers connected.
Eventually managed to get the two controllers to register with the game but when they did there was suddenly three selections active in every menu e.g. you were seeing highlighted options for new game, load game, quit game etc. and selecting one was a lottery cos you never knew which one you were actually highlighting as one controller moved all three up and down...

Anyways, aside from that weird bug with menus, both controllers also controlled just the one character and not p1 and p2 separately. Both inputs were feeding into p1 and the only help online was "turn off p1 controller option and use keyboard"...
Like that is of any help for console or handheld users right?

Totally wasted my time and upset my kids dearly so got them human fall flat to satisfy their wobbly desires.
Seemed like a fun, daft game but turned out to be a complete disappointment and a massive head ache.
Which when you consider my 400-ish games in my library with only a handful of negative reviews, really should make you stop and think. 

╭∩╮( ＾◡＾)╭∩╮

I am surprised at the overwhelmingly positive reviews honestly... I usually only see these on games that are actual masterpieces.

This game is fine at best and I would give it a neutral review if I could, but i had to refund it because it gave me motion sickness within the first 30 minutes of playing.

Pros:
- Family friendly
- Lots of activities
- Free updates

Cons:
- Wonky controls and camera.
- Repetitive and grindy
- Not much replayability once I did a task I did not want to do it again.

I cannot stand this game and my son demanded I buy it.
There is so much reading to do and you would think they might have made a voice instructions by now to save time.
There is stairs in many buildings, but the character cannot climb stairs. I mean honestly!!
The instructions are always vague, and we spend hours just trying to find something that is hidden or disappears the moment you drop it. honestly. My son is asking me to do everything because its making him upset all the time. I didnt buy the game for me, its terrible, but he keeps making me play.

Maybe I should have been able to tell, but this is a children's game and that wasn't obvious from the store page. It's not bad for what it is, but if you're not a young child this won't resonate with you, and you'll be out $25

At least when on a steam deck dock with two controllers connected.
Eventually managed to get the two controllers to register with the game but when they did there was suddenly three selections active in every menu e.g. you were seeing highlighted options for new game, load game, quit game etc. and selecting one was a lottery cos you never knew which one you were actually highlighting as one controller moved all three up and down...

Anyways, aside from that weird bug with menus, both controllers also controlled just the one character and not p1 and p2 separately. Both inputs were feeding into p1 and the only help online was "turn off p1 controller option and use keyboard"...
Like that is of any help for console or handheld users right?

Totally wasted my time and upset my kids dearly so got them human fall flat to satisfy their wobbly desires.
Seemed like a fun, daft game but turned out to be a complete disappointment and a massive head ache.
Which when you consider my 400-ish games in my library with only a handful of negative reviews, really should make you stop and think. 

╭∩╮( ＾◡＾)╭∩╮

I am surprised at the overwhelmingly positive reviews honestly... I usually only see these on games that are actual masterpieces.

This game is fine at best and I would give it a neutral review if I could, but i had to refund it because it gave me motion sickness within the first 30 minutes of playing.

Pros:
- Family friendly
- Lots of activities
- Free updates

Cons:
- Wonky controls and camera.
- Repetitive and grindy
- Not much replayability once I did a task I did not want to do it again.

I cannot stand this game and my son demanded I buy it.
There is so much reading to do and you would think they might have made a voice instructions by now to save time.
There is stairs in many buildings, but the character cannot climb stairs. I mean honestly!!
The instructions are always vague, and we spend hours just trying to find something that is hidden or disappears the moment you drop it. honestly. My son is asking me to do everything because its making him upset all the time. I didnt buy the game for me, its terrible, but he keeps making me play.

Maybe I should have been able to tell, but this is a children's game and that wasn't obvious from the store page. It's not bad for what it is, but if you're not a young child this won't resonate with you, and you'll be out $25
